author: mini_mads1980
title: Another ATV
review:
This only costs £5 in the UK, and is supposed to be an "impulse buy" set which to me feels like Lego forgot to make the set interesting.

Box/Instructions

The box is the smallest of the City set boxes.  On the front is a nice looking picture of the crook running away from the swamp policeman, who is in his ATV.  You can also see in the picture the hiding spot for the crook's stolen money and bag.  The sides and bottom of the box have the standard information.

The top of the box has a picture of the swamp policeman, having just caught a dangerous looking snake and the 1:1 is the crook from the set.  The back shows the crook hiding his money and then a picture of the crook being led away with the swamp policeman carrying a bag with only 100 note in it - what happen to the other 100?? 

The instruction booklet is 24 pages long.  It has the same picture as the box front and surprisingly on page 22 has a list of older City Police sets (60041, 60042, 60043, 60044, 60046 and 60047) before a list of the parts in the set.

Parts

The parts in this set are nothing special, however the 2x1 slope at the front of the ATV is a printed piece, so that is a bonus as no stickers are used at all.

Minifigures

You get two in this set.  A lower ranked swamp policeman and a crook who appears to be the identical twin brother of the one in the Starter Set 60066.

The build

It is a basic build, but with only 59 pieces you were never going to have a set that was too hard to put together.

The completed model

It does what it is supposed to do, I just feel that a small police boat would have suited the swamp feel of this batch of police sets better.

Overall opinion

The set is solid enough and you have the playability of good v bad, even if the crook has no chance of escape against the ATV so any chase would be short lived.  If you want all the sets (like I do) in this range then get this one.  If you want a small set for a few pounds then get 60066 which is by far a better set with double the minifugures (one the same as this set), a means of transport for both swamp police and crooks with a lot more playability and hours more fun.

author: PicnicBasketSam
title: Yet Another ATV!
review:
It's PicnicBasketSam yet again, reviewing yet another tiny CITY set! Today it's the smallest Swamp Police set, which I bought on impulse for a few parts, namely, the snake and printed cheese slope.

Box/Instructions

As I covered in my review of 60011, the box and instructions are standard $7 size. A surprisingly large number of parts flow out when I open up all the bags... it's already better than 60011.

Parts

As the main thing I got the set for, they don't disappoint. A brand-new variant of the 1x1 clip, a red snake, a big dark green life, $200 in LEGO money, and a printed 1x2 cheese slope that says "POLICE" in block capitals. Plus, there's 59 of them... I half expected the set to be $10 with that many.

Minifigures

An outdoorsy-looking cop and a standard crook. I love that dark tan baseball cap.

The build

Fast. Only worrying thing I found is that there's a 2x6 brick instead of several plates in the base, which makes it look too chunky for a swamp-equipped off-roader.

The completed model

It does the job better than the last 2 ATVs. Gone is the empty wheelbarrow, replaced by some swamp scenery and a sack. Gone is the futuristic looking and clip-covered ATV style, replaced by a more outdoorsy, chunky, realistic design. There's even a play feature with the swamp scenery; you can put money or snakes under the big leaf. Nothing astounding, but still... wheelbarrows.

Overall opinion

This is an even better impulse set than Surfer Rescue. It has twice as many parts, a creature, two figs, and a sizable build for each one. It outdos ATVs from 2013 and 2014 by a huge amount and doesn't look futuristic or dorky. One of the best Swamp Police sets. Buy one! Right now!
